page.title: 08CHANGING HOUSING:OASTS.
page.content: Because hop growing is declining,a lot of oasts in Kent are converted.There are 3 nearby which suggests that they are very popular.Martins Farm is a converted oast in Collier Street.It was bought for 18,500 pounds in 1978 though would now sell for 120,000 pounds.When it was bought ,the roof was falling in and it had no water,electricity or windows.After 9 months the family were able to move in and 15 months later all the rooms were in use..it cost 30,000 pounds.They preferred converting the square oast as furniture was easier to fit.They liked the oast as it was part of the character of Kent.The oast house is very spacious and there are 12 rooms.One disadvantage of living in an oast house is that the water pipes burst in the winter because the roof is open.Also the law says that you cannot put an extension on an oast house.
